net.rim.device.api.io.nfc.ndef
Class NDEFRecord

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.device.api.io.nfc.ndef.NDEFRecord
Direct Known Subclasses:
SmartPosterRecord, TextRecord, URIRecord
public class NDEFRecord
extends Object

Represents an NDEF record as specified by the NFC Forum. Provides methods to set and retrieve NDEF record properties.

Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

Field Summary
static int TNF_ABSOLUTE_URI
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for an absolute URI type.
static int TNF_ANY
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for any record type.
static int TNF_EMPTY
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for an empty record.
static int TNF_EXTERNAL
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for application specific record type names that follow NFC Forum naming conventions.
static int TNF_MEDIA
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for a MIME type.
static int TNF_UNCHANGED
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for an unchanged record type.
static int TNF_UNKNOWN
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for an unknown record type.
static int TNF_WELL_KNOWN
          Constant that indicates the record type name format identifier for a "well known type" as defined by the NFC Forum.
 
Constructor Summary

          Creates an empty NDEF record.

          Creates an empty NDEF record, setting the Type Name Format and Type Name Format string.

Constructor Detail

NDEFRecord

public NDEFRecord()
Creates an empty NDEF record.

Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

NDEFRecord

public NDEFRecord(int TNF,
                  String TNFString)
           throws NFCException
Creates an empty NDEF record, setting the Type Name Format and Type Name Format string.

Parameters:
TNF - An integer in the range specified by the NDEF specification for Type Name Format.
TNFString - The Type Name Format string. This value must be set according to the NDEF specification. The requirements depend on the value of the TNF parameter.
Throws:
NFCException - If the TNF value is out of the valid range.
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

isFirstRecord

public boolean isFirstRecord()
Indicates whether this is the first record.

Returns:
true if this is the first record; false otherwise.
Since:

setType

public void setType(int typeNameFormat,
                    String type)
             throws NFCException
Sets the Type Name Format and optional Type Name Format string. See the constants defined in this class.

Parameters:
typeNameFormat - The Type Name Format.
type - The Type Name Format string.
Throws:
NFCException - When Type Name Format is invalid.
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0
